channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [AMQP-532] ConcurrentModificationException in PublisherCallbackChannelImpl
item.description:
While testing continuous publishing to a RabbitMQ node that I blocked network traffic to (simulating a network partition), I got this ConcurrentModificationException in PublisherCallbackChannelImpl, the line number indicates that this happened in the pendingConfirms map. Looking at the source code, the code is guarded by synchronizing on the map, while other places in the code where the map is accessed are synchronized on the PublisherCallbackChannelImpl itself.

Stacktrace below:

item.environment: Java8 on Ubuntu, Spring Boot, Spring Integration.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This is fixed on master (and in the 1.4.x and 1.3.x branches); we will release 1.4.6 next week along with 1.5.0.

You can test with 1.4.6.BUILD-SNAPSHOT from the snapshot repo if you wish, until 1.4.6.RELEASE is available.
Thank you, I can see now I was incorrect with regard to the cause of the bug (looked at the wrong line number).

Hello again!

Thank you for fixing what looked like a threading/concurrency issue. I got the 1.5.0.RELEASE, run my tests and the exception was thrown on first run. It turns out it is not concurrent access by different threads that cause the exception to be raised, but rather that entries in the map are the removed (by the same thread) while you are looping though it in generateNacksForPendingAcks; it calls handleNack and then processAck which removes PendingConfirm s.

So if you have two PendingConfirm s when close is called, you end up with the ConcurrentModificationException

That is actually quite easy to reproduce, here is a little list case:

@Test
 
    public void testPublisherCallbackChannelImpl() throws Exception {
 
 
 
        Listener listener = new Listener() {
 
 
 
            private final UUID id = UUID.randomUUID();
 
 
 
            @Override
 
            public void removePendingConfirmsReference(final Channel channel,
 
                    final SortedMap<Long, PendingConfirm> unconfirmed) {
 
                // NOOP
 
            }
 
 
 
            @Override
 
            public boolean isReturnListener() {
 
                return false;
 
            }
 
 
 
            @Override
 
            public boolean isConfirmListener() {
 
                return true;
 
            }
 
 
 
            @Override
 
            public void handleReturn(final int replyCode,
 
                    final String replyText,
 
                    final String exchange,
 
                    final String routingKey,
 
                    final AMQP.BasicProperties properties,
 
                    final byte[] body) throws IOException {
 
                // NOOP
 
 
 
            }
 
 
 
            @Override
 
            public void handleConfirm(final PendingConfirm pendingConfirm, final boolean ack) {
 
                System.out.println("handleConfirm: " + pendingConfirm + " Ack ? " + ack);
 
            }
 
 
 
            @Override
 
            public String getUUID() {
 
                return id.toString();
 
            }
 
        };
 
 
 
        Channel channelMock = Mockito.mock(Channel.class);
 
 
 
        PublisherCallbackChannelImpl channel = new PublisherCallbackChannelImpl(channelMock);
 
 
 
        channel.addListener(listener);
 
 
 
        for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
 
            long seq = i + 1000;
 
            channel.addPendingConfirm(listener, seq, new PendingConfirm(new CorrelationData(Long.toHexString(seq)),
 
                    System.currentTimeMillis()));
 
        }
 
 
 
        channel.close();
 
 
 
    }

Here is the stack trace I got:

java.util.ConcurrentModificationException: null
 
        at java.util.TreeMap$PrivateEntryIterator.nextEntry(TreeMap.java:1207) ~[na:1.8.0_60]
 
        at java.util.TreeMap$EntryIterator.next(TreeMap.java:1243) ~[na:1.8.0_60]
 
        at java.util.TreeMap$EntryIterator.next(TreeMap.java:1238) ~[na:1.8.0_60]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.support.PublisherCallbackChannelImpl.generateNacksForPendingAcks(PublisherCallbackChannelImpl.java:641) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.support.PublisherCallbackChannelImpl.close(PublisherCallbackChannelImpl.java:635) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.CachingConnectionFactory.getChannel(CachingConnectionFactory.java:383) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.CachingConnectionFactory.access$1200(CachingConnectionFactory.java:86) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.CachingConnectionFactory$ChannelCachingConnectionProxy.createChannel(CachingConnectionFactory.java:838) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.ConnectionFactoryUtils$1.createChannel(ConnectionFactoryUtils.java:85) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.ConnectionFactoryUtils.doGetTransactionalResourceHolder(ConnectionFactoryUtils.java:134) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.ConnectionFactoryUtils.getTransactionalResourceHolder(ConnectionFactoryUtils.java:67) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate.doExecute(RabbitTemplate.java:1278) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate.execute(RabbitTemplate.java:1271) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate.execute(RabbitTemplate.java:1247) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitAdmin.initialize(RabbitAdmin.java:431) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitAdmin$11.onCreate(RabbitAdmin.java:351) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]

        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.CachingConnectionFactory.createConnection(CachingConnectionFactory.java:502) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.CachingConnectionFactory.createBareChannel(CachingConnectionFactory.java:446) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.CachingConnectionFactory.getCachedChannelProxy(CachingConnectionFactory.java:419) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.CachingConnectionFactory.getChannel(CachingConnectionFactory.java:412) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.CachingConnectionFactory.access$1200(CachingConnectionFactory.java:86) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.CachingConnectionFactory$ChannelCachingConnectionProxy.createChannel(CachingConnectionFactory.java:838) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.ConnectionFactoryUtils$1.createChannel(ConnectionFactoryUtils.java:85) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.ConnectionFactoryUtils.doGetTransactionalResourceHolder(ConnectionFactoryUtils.java:134) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.connection.ConnectionFactoryUtils.getTransactionalResourceHolder(ConnectionFactoryUtils.java:67) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.listener.BlockingQueueConsumer.start(BlockingQueueConsumer.java:456) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer$AsyncMessageProcessingConsumer.run(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:1158) ~[spring-rabbit-1.5.0.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) [na:1.8.0_60]
 
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) [na:1.8.0_60]
 
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) [na:1.8.0_60]
Artem Bilan Perhaps if we get this reviewed/merged soon, we can release 1.4.6 before SpringOne and perhaps 1.5.1 after SpringOne ?
Tested with 1.4.6.BUILD-SNAPSHOT and works as expected. Will there be a release 1.4.6 or 1.5.1 any time soon?

Rolf Arne Corneliussen Thanks for testing; we got a bit side-tracked with the SpringOne2GX conference.

I will release both today or tomorrow.
1.4.6 and 1.5.1 are now available; thanks again for finding this.
